description: From Middle English plaintif, from Anglo-Norman, from Old French plaintif (“complaining”; as a noun, “one who complains, a plaintiff”) from the verb plaindre. Doublet of plaintive.

entries.meaning: (law, UK historical, otherwise current) A party bringing a suit in civil law against a defendant; accuser.
examples: Synonyms: actor, (English law) claimant, complainant, litigant, (Scottish law) pursuer
